Law&Order Briefs Print Email 2011-11-01T00:00:00Z Law&Order Briefs Arizona Daily Star Arizona Daily Star Arizona Daily Star November 01, 2011 12:00 am • Arizona Daily Star Arizona Daily Star Woman's body found in south-side wash
A woman was found dead Monday in a wash near South Palo Verde Road and Interstate 10.
Deputies went to the area at 2:30 p.m. after receiving a 911 call from someone at a pay telephone at a nearby fast-food restaurant, said Deputy Dawn Barkman, a Pima County Sheriff's Department spokeswoman.
Detectives termed the death "suspicious," Barkman said.
The woman's identity is unknown, and an autopsy is scheduled today at the county Medical Examiner's Office, Barkman said.
3 men arrested in robbery, carjack spree
Police arrested three men in connection with a string of Sunday robberies.
Axel Jaimez, 26, Robert Cota, 18, and Olivaz Cruz, 21, were arrested Sunday on felony charges related to robbery and auto theft, said Sgt. Maria Hawke, a Tucson police spokeswoman.
Hawke gave this account in a news release:
The first incident happened shortly after 4:30 a.m. near East Adams Street and North Bentley Avenue when three men stole a white 2004 Chrysler Sebring convertible from a group of four women leaving a Halloween party.
The men flashed handguns at the women and demanded the car keys as well as purses and cellphones.
About 7:15 p.m., two men robbed the owner of El Kora hot dog stand, near South Sixth Avenue and West Bilby Road, at gunpoint. The owner said they drove up in a Chrysler convertible.
Then, police received a carjacking call at 8:50 p.m. near South 12th Avenue and West 39th Street. In that incident, two men, one of whom flashed a handgun, drove up in a Chrysler convertible, confronting two men at their vehicle. The robbers demanded car keys, wallets and cellphones. One drove away in the victims' gray 2005 Nissan Altima, which was later abandoned near South 12th Avenue and West Ajo Way.
Police saw the Chrysler convertible near East Irvington Road and South Sixth Avenue about 9:30 p.m., and briefly chased the car until the driver crashed. Police caught two men, and a third, who ran away, was soon found and arrested. The three were booked into the Pima County jail.
Veronica M. Cruz
Worker accused of indecent exposure
A man was arrested Sunday on suspicion of exposing himself to a child at an east-side restaurant.
Elias Guerrero, 24, an employee of Wing Factory at 6330 E. Golf Links Road, lifted up his shirt, exposing himself to a 9-year-old girl, said Sgt. Maria Hawke, a Tucson Police Department spokeswoman, in a news release. The girl was at the restaurant with her family but had gone to the counter alone to ask for sauce.
Guerrero was booked into the Pima County jail. He has a history of exposing himself and is registered as a Level 3 sex offender in California, police said.
Veronica M. Cruz
Deputies seek woman who robbed bank
Pima County sheriff's deputies are looking for a woman suspected of robbing the Compass Bank branch inside Albertson's at 5085 N. La Cañada Drive at 4 p.m. Thursday.
The woman is described as black, 40 to 45 years old, and 5-feet-4-inches tall, with black hair, said Deputy Erin Gibson, a spokeswoman, in a news release.
A witness saw a woman of that description get into a sport utility vehicle that drove north on La Cañada Drive. Investigators ask that anyone with information call 911 or 88-CRIME.
Veronica M. Cruz
Carmen Duarte
